title.narrative: IMPROVED NUTRITION PRACTICES AND BEHAVIOURS

description.narrative: Improved nutrition practices and behaviours, including increased demand for and utilization of nutrition services, which contributes to Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children under 5, pregnant and lactating women, and adolescents have access to and utilize quality and effective nutrition services, and adopt improved nutrition practices

sector.narrative: Diet diversity in early childhood, including complementary feeding, multiple micronutrient powders and lipid-based nutrition supplements
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting and wasting (excludes intervention specific strategies)
Technical assistance - Early detection and treatment of malnutrition

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved nutrition practices and behaviours, including increased demand for and utilization of nutrition services

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the government to address MIYCN issues by empowering parents with practical skills to improve MIYCN behaviour and practices in COVID-19 and development setting through modelling a peer-to-peer network reaching over 1,000 under-five children and their caregivers. Different IEC materials were developed and distributed to 60,000 CHWs, 48 district hospitals and 500 health centres, offered capacity building to 547 health frontline workers to ensure efficient rollout of nutrition activities, 86 per cent of caregivers of the children under five years were reached with MIYCN messages. ;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2021
